clinical_study.brief_title: First Aid by Laypersons - Effect on Mortality and Length of Stay
clinical_study.official_title: Førstehjelp Gjort av Lekfolk-effekt på dødelighet og behandlingsforløp (First Aid by Laypersons - Effect on Mortality and Length of Stay)

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to assess the effect of first aid from bystanders on survival, admission length, and need of ICU-stay for trauma victims.

detailed_description.textblock: All ambulance services in Norway will be invited to participate. In the participating ambulance services, the personnel of first unit to reach the scene of accident for any emergency response to trauma will register what first aid measures (if any) are indicated and have been performed by the bystanders on the scene up til the point where the ambulance arrives. Hospital data for each case will be retrieved. Those patients who did receive correct first aid will then be compared to those patients who did not receive first aid, and those where first aid was attempted but not correct for differences in share of survivors, length of hospital stay, and need for admission to ICU.

primary_outcome.description: Length of hospital stay after injury, in days
30-day survival, starting from day of injury
Whether patient is admitted to ICU during admission

secondary_outcome.description: Length of ICU stay if patient was admitted to ICU, in days

other_outcome.measure: Whether patients received first aid from bystanders
other_outcome.description: If patients with indicated measures receiving first aid from bystanders, given for each measure and combined

other_outcome.measure: Whether first aid measures were indicated for the patient
other_outcome.description: If first aid measures was indicated, given for each measure and combined

arm_group.description: Patient has received first aid according to local guidelines for all indicated first aid measures from bystanders on scene of accident when the first ambulance arrives
Bystanders have attempted first aid for indicated first aid measures, but measures have been incorrectly performed according to local guidelines
Indicated first aid measures have not been carried out when the first ambulance arrives on scene

intervention.description: Open airway (head tilt, chin lift), recovery position, staunch of bleeding, prevention of hypothermia, cooling of burn, CPR

study_pop.textblock: All patients who has sustained an injury and where the EMS has been alerted and initiated an emergency response

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All emergency response calls to trauma (drownings and hangings included)
Exclusion Criteria:
- No injury to patient
- Non-traumatic condition
- Poisonings
